content:
• Tuesday, May 29, 2018
  • RUBI

    Rubicon Project says it's ridden out bumps from Europe's GDPR

    • Ad-tech firm the Rubicon Project (NYSE:RUBI) says it's gotten past a "short-term disruption" in sales from Europe's imposition of new privacy regulations, Bloomberg reports.
    • The General Data Protection Regulation took effect Friday, spurring a flood of emails from companies seeking consent to track people online.
    • “We have seen spend stabilize across most of our demand partners and we are seeing solid monetization in Europe,” Chief Technology Officer Tom Kershaw told the news service.
    • Shares in RUBI rose 2.2% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCHX

    Marchex -3.8% as it trims revenue outlook

    • Marchex (NASDAQ:MCHX) is 3.8% lower after hours after the company issued an updated outlook where it trimmed guidance.
    • For the current (second) quarter, Marchex now sees revenues of $19.5M-$21M; that's below the previous guidance for $21M.
    • “While we continue to create meaningful customer opportunities for 2018, particularly with our analytics products, media marketplace budget allocation changes from a few of our customers have caused us to revise our revenue outlook for the second quarter,” CFO Mike Arends says.
    • It's reiterating previous guidance for an operating loss of $2M or better, an adjusted OIBA loss of $1M or better, and adjusted EBITDA of break-even or better.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM
  • PKX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (05/29/2018)

    • Top gainers: PKX +5.5%. CRM +4.0%. NVIV +3.7%. SPTN +3.6%. CZZ +1.9%.
    • Top Losers: TTOO -7.2%. TXMD -1.9%.  CDTX -1.8%. OCN -1.6%. KOS -1.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 23 Comments
  • CRM

    Salesforce +3.1% on Q1 beats, guidance includes MuleSoft acquisition

    • Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) shares are up 3.1% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 26% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Guidance note: Salesforce’s C2 and FY19 includes MuleSoft so the estimates might not be directly comparable. 
    • Q2 guidance has revenue of $3.22B to $3.23B (consensus: $3.11B) and EPS of $0.46 to $0.47 (consensus: $0.52). 
    • FY19 guidance has revenue of $13.075B to $13.125B (consensus: $12.76B; was: $12.66B to $12.71B). 
    • Revenue breakdown: Subscription and support, $2.81B (+27% Y/Y); Professional services and other revenue, $196M (+4%). 
    • Key metrics: Unearned revenue of $6.2B (+25%); remaining transaction price, $20.4B (+36%); operating cash flow, $1.47B (+19%); cash from operations, $1.47B (+19%); cash and equivalents, $7.16B. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM Eastern with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Salesforce.com beats by $0.06, beats on revenue (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • TTOO

    T2 Biosystems readies equity offering; shares down 9% after hours

    • T2 Biosystems (NASDAQ:TTOO) launches a public offering of 5.65M shares of common stock. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 847.5K shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
    • Shares are down 9% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 11 Comments
  • CRM

    Salesforce.com beats by $0.06, beats on revenue

    • Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM): Q1 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $3.01B (+25.9% Y/Y) beats by $70M.
    • Shares +2%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 21 Comments
  • THR

    Thermon +5% after William Blair says 20%-40% rally possible

    • Thermon (THR +4.6%) bucks today's broad market losses after William Blair maintains its Outperform rating, seeing potential for a 20%-40% upside in the shares over the next 12 months.
    • Blair analyst Brian Drab attributes THR's sharp pullback following its FQ4 report to the 3%-5% organic revenue growth guidance for FY 2019, which was below expectations but looks "extremely conservative," particularly given the company will enjoy its easiest comparison as a public company in Q1.
    • Drab expects THR to produce "solid" growth throughout FY 2019 and says he would not be surprised to see the company upwardly revise its forecast throughout the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley leads big banks down; sees `challenging' environment for wealth

    • Morgan Stanley (MS -5.5%) led the banking sector down as Italy's political drama reverberated in global markets. In trade news, the U.S. is proceeding with its threat to apply tariffs on Chinese imports, the Wall Street Journal says.
    • MS fell more than most. Andy Saperstein, co-head of the bank's wealth management unit, says he sees "headwinds' in transaction revenue because activity slowed in March and remained slower in April and May, CNBC reports, citing Saperstein's comments at a New York conference today.
    • MS interest expense will increase as it diversifies its deposit sources, which in turn, will slow the growth of net interest income, Saperstein said.
    • About half of Morgan Stanley's revenue comes from its wealth management unit.
    • Other banks also felt the pain resulting from today's global economic news: Bank of America (BAC -3.8%), Citigroup (C -3.9%), JPMorgan (JPM -4.2%), Wells Fargo (WFC -3.3%), and Goldman Sachs (GS -3.3%).
    • Previously: U.S. banks take a hit as investors fret over Italy and Spain (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 16 Comments
  • CVRR

    CVR Energy -12%, CVR Refining +5% on exchange plan

    • Shares of CVR Refining (CVRR +5.2%) and CVR Energy (CVI -11.7%) head in opposite directions following plans to launch an offering to exchange CVI common shares for as many as ~37.15M CVRR units.
    • The deal values CVRR at $27.63/unit, a 25% premium to Friday's closing price, with investors receiving 0.6335 of a CVI share for each unit they now own.
    • If CVRR investors exchange the maximum units available for exchange, CVI and its affiliates - including affiliates of Icahn Enterprises - would increase their holdings of CVRR to ~95% from 69.8% currently.
    • Earlier: CVR Energy declares $0.75 dividend (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 19 Comments
  • MOMO

    Momo +14.7% as analysts chime in after earnings topper

    • Momo (MOMO +14.7%) is building on gains today that followed built on an easy beat in its Q1 earnings, with revenues topping even the most bullish Street estimate.
    • Morgan Stanley expects analysts to revise earnings estimates higher on "multiple drivers," the bank said after earnings. Momo is its top pick among Chinese online entertainment companies.
    • Meanwhile, Citi has raised its price target to $56, from $43; with the Nasdaq quote currently at $44.68, that implies 25% further upside to come.
    • Previously: Momo +9.2% on Q1 beats, 18% MAU growth (May. 29 2018)
    • Previously: Momo beats by $0.19, beats on revenue (May. 29 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 15 Comments
  • NLY

    Bond prices melt up on EU shudders

    • The 10-year Italian BTP yield flew higher by 43 basis points today to 3.10%, sending money scurrying into the safe-haven bond markets of the U.S., Germany, and the U.K.
    • The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield has plunged a full 16 basis points to 2.77%, its lowest level in nearly two months. TLT +1.9%, TBT -3.8%
    • The two-year Treasury yield is down 15 basis points to 2.33%.
    • Today's 1.5% selloff in the S&P 500 is as broad as it gets, with even utilities (XLU -0.3%) in the red. The only sector in the green is just barely so, with the iShares U.S. Real Estate ETF (NYSEARCA:IYR) up a mere 0.05%. Within the REITs, the mortgage REITs (REM +0.6%) are enjoying a boost to book values, led by Annaly Capital (NLY +0.9%) and AGNC Investment (AGNC +0.7%).
    • Equity REITs working today: Realty Income (O +0.7%), Ventas (VTR +0.5%), Senior Housing (SNH +1%), Tanger Factory (SKT +0.6%), CBL (CBL +1.1%), Stag Industrial (STAG +0.5%), Government Properties (GOV-OLD +2%), Public Storage (PSA +0.3%), Preferred Apartment (APTS +1.4%).
    • ETFs: VNQ, MORL, IYR, REM, IEF, RQI, MORT, SCHH, RNP, RFI, KBWY, DRN, NRO, URE, ICF, XLRE, JRS, RWR, SRS, PST, FREL, DRA, DRV, IEI, RIF, VGIT
     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 28 Comments
  • MYSZ

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (05/29/2018)

    • Gainers: MYSZ +16%. PI +14%. MOMO +14%. WIN +12%. MOSY +8%.
    • Losers: INFN -10%. OIBR-C -10%. ZDGE -8%. QD -8%. VEON -7%.
      •  
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • BWA

    Sputtering vibe in the auto parts sector

    • The auto parts sector is having a weak day as investors weigh turmoil in Italy and a cut by Nissan in U.S. production.
    • There's also tariff anxiety in the wind again.
    • "Trump’s consideration of a 25% tariff on automotive imports is likely just a threat, but will create protracted uncertainty that could slow investment and sourcing," warns Bloomberg Intelligence analyst Caitlin Webber.
    • Decliners include BorgWarner (BWA -5.8%), American Axle & Manufacturing (AXL -5.1%), Tenneco (TEN -5.3%), Meritor (MTOR -3.6%), Dana (DAN -3.7%), Westport Fuel Systems (WPRT -2.7%), Autoliv (ALV -2.9%), Delphi Technologies (DLPH -2.8%), Superior Industries International (SUP -5.8%) and WABCO Holdings (WBC -2.7%).
    • Previously: Nissan to cut U.S. production this summer (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 10 Comments
  • NXTD

    Nxt-ID announces long-term debt refinancing

    • Nxt-ID (NXTD -0.5%) announced a new $16M senior secured term loan due 2023.
    • The Company will use the proceeds from the Term Loan to refinance its existing revolving loan facility and to pay for accrued interest and costs associated with the refinancing and working capital and general corporate purposes.
    • "This transaction significantly lowers our interest rate which will significantly increase our cash flow," said the Company's Chief Executive Officer, Gino Pereira. "It provides stability to our balance sheet and improves our overall financial position, which will help serve as a catalyst for future growth. This is a positive step forward for the Company."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors earnings preview

    • Michael Kors (KORS) reports earnings tomorrow before the opening bell in NYC.
    • Analysts expect the company to report revenue of $1.15B and EPS of $0.60. Comparable sales growth of -1.3% is anticipated, with a 8.0% rise in the Europe partially offsetting a 4% decline in North America.
    • Kors is seen generating gross margin of 59.1% of sales during the quarter and operating margin of 10% of sales.
    • Shares of Kors are up 7.5% since the last time the company reported earnings.
    • Sources: MarketWatch, Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • DIS

    ABC cancels hit 'Roseanne' after star's tweet; DIS -2.6%

    • Disney (NYSE:DIS) shares are down 2.6% after ABC announces an abrupt cancellation of hit show Roseanne, a reaction to a racist tweet the show's star posted earlier.
    • Roseanne Barr posted a tweet that compared Valerie Jarrett, a former adviser to president Obama, to an ape, spurring an immediate backlash. Barr later issued an apology via Twitter.
    • Disney CEO Robert Iger said "There was only one thing to do here, and that was the right thing."
    • ABC Entertainment President Channing Dungey said "Roseanne's Twitter statement is abhorrent, repugnant and inconsistent with our values, and we have decided to cancel her show."
    • "Muslim brotherhood & planet of the apes had a baby=vj," Barr had said in a now-deleted tweet.
    • The show was the best performing of ABC's season, with an average of 18.7M viewers.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 640 Comments
  • VSAT

    Viasat wins business from Embraer; shares up 1.3%

    • Viasat (VSAT +1.3%) over the weekend announced Embraer (NYSE:ERJ) as having selected the company's Ka-band connectivity solution for its Legacy 450 and Legacy 500 executive jets.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • TUSK

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (05/29/2018)

    • Gainers: TUSK +21%. EMX +15%. GBR +14%. KRP +8%. CVRR +8%.
    • Losers: WMLP-OLD -15%. CVI -10%. UPL -10%. SID -8%. BAK -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • RTW

    Investors bid up New York & Company

    • Shares of New York & Company (NWY +12.2%) jump to a 52-week high as post-earnings sentiment on the retailer stays strong.
    • During last week's conference call, CEO Greg Scott noted that the company is seeing store traffic ahead of industry norms and a "significant" increase in the average sale transaction size. He also noted that several margin-eroding promotional events have been removed from the calendar.
    • New York & Company earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • BOSC

    More on B.O.S. Better Online Solutions Q1 results

    • B.O.S. Better Online Solutions (BOSC +0.1%) reported Q1 revenue growth of 17.4% Y/Y to $8.29M. Segment revenues: RFID & mobile solutions $3.82M (+14%) and Supply chain solutions $4.59M (+17% Y/Y).
    • Q1 Overall margins: gross declined by 43 bps to 20.03%, operating improved by 10 bps to 3.46% and EBITDA was flat at 4.4%.
    • Segment gross margin: RFID & mobile solutions improved by 186 bps to 25.5% and supply chain solutions declined by 249 bps to 14.9%.
    • The company has ~8k active customers with 5k in the RFID mobile division and 3k in the supply chain division.
    • FY18 outlook: Revenue $29M and net income of $800K.
    • Previously: B.O.S. Better Online reports Q1 results (May 29)
    • Transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • DHX

    DHI Group soars after TCS takes stake

    • DHI Group (NYSE:DHX) is up 24.3% to rise to its highest level of 2018 after TCS Capital reports holding a stake and expresses a willingness to acquire the company.
    • DHI management presented at a conference hosted by FBR last Friday, highlighting that the company's priorities include disciplined reinvestment, finding small bolt-on acquisitions, debt reduction and capital returns.
    • DHI investment presentation slides
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • EDUC

    Educational Development slides 16% post FY results

    • Educational Development (EDUC -16.5%) reports fiscal revenue growth of 5% Y/Y to $112M & net earnings of $5.2M (+82% Y/Y)
    • Direct sales division, Usborne Books & More: Net revenues of 97.6M (+6% Y/Y); continued to have strong growth this year driven by the success and growth of active sales consultants.
    • Number of active direct sales consultants were 35,500 (+38% Y/Y).
    • Publishing division: Net revenues of $8.3M (-8% Y/Y); decline in net revenues was due to a decline in sales to two of large national retail book chain customers that had reduced purchasing volumes.
    • Quarterly cash dividend of $0.10 per share will be paid on June 21, 2018.
    • “With the improvements in our profitability, our increase in cash on hand and our ability to access additional cash through our $15M line of credit with our bank, we expect we have the necessary cash flows to operate our business & fund future growth.” said Randall White, CEO.
    • Previously: Educational Development Corporation reports FY results (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 12 Comments
  • TVTY

    Tivity Health down 8% on short call by OWS

    • Tivity Health (TVTY -7.9%) slumps on modestly higher volume on the heels of a short call at Off Wall Street, citing 24% downside risk.
    • Negative catalysts are slowing growth of top program SilverSneakers and pressure from fitness centers to increase per-visit payments, currently lower than competitors.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • QD

    Qudian -7.2% with no current catalyst, potential upcoming catalyst

    • Qudian (NYSE:QD) shares drop 7.2% to $8.12 with no clear current catalyst.  
    • Interesting note from the 20-F filed in April: The one-year agreement with Alibaba’s (NYSE:BABA) Alipay for the QuCampus project expires in August. Qudian said if Alipay fails to renew the plan, Qudian could have a harder time engaging new borrowers. Watch for the potential catalyst in the coming months.  
    • Qudian shares are down 23.7% in the past week, 10.7% in the past month, and 30.1% YTD. 
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 7 Comments
  • SPOT

    Pivotal gets bullish on Spotify, sees 30% upside

    • Pivotal is joining the bulls on parade for Spotify (SPOT -1.7%), initiating coverage at Buy with a healthy price target.
    • The firm set a $200 target, among the highest on the Street; Canaccord Genuity set a $200 price target last month, as did MKM Partners. (Royal Bank of Canada recently lowered its price target to $210 from $220.)
    • That $200 target implies 30% upside from today's lower price.
    • Overall, analysts are bumping price targets higher lately.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • LEJU

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (05/29/2018)

    • Gainers: LEJU +18%. JP +11%. YRIV +6%.
    • Losers: LYL -17%. IHT -16%. YRD -11%. SAN -9%. PAGS -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • CODX

    Genetic testing firms buck market down move

    • Many genetic testing players are shrugging off the broad market's bearish mood with Co-Diagnostics leading the way, up 64%.
    • Selected tickers: (CODX +64.2%)(MYND +18.5%)(OCX +14.6%)(DGX +0.2%)(LH -1.6%)(CGIX -3.9%)(NVTA +1.7%)(MYGN +3.2%)(NEOG +0.2%)(GHDX +0.1%)(BIOC +6%)(TROV +0.9%)(PRPO -5.6%)(FLGT +1.3%)(GENE -2.5%)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 7 Comments
  • AMC

    Theater stocks lower after Solo numbers disappoint

    • Theater stocks are lower after Solo: A Star Wars Story falls short of box office expectations during the extended Memorial Day weekend.
    • Media analysts are mixed on if lukewarm reviews or Star Wars fatigue is to blame for the 4-day haul $103M vs. $130M to $150M anticipated.
    • AMC Entertainment (AMC -2.3%), Cinemark Holdings (CNK -2.5%), Marcus Corporation (MCS -1%) and IMAX (IMAX -0.7%) are all trading down.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • SGBAF

    SES, Intelsat move as Morgan Stanley embraces C-band proposal

    • SES (OTCPK:SGBAF) is up 1% in OTC trading after an upgrade to Equal Weight by Morgan Stanley, now anticipating a "too big to ignore" potential impact from the company's C-band spectrum.
    • Intelsat (NYSE:I) -- a partner with SES in the proposal to share C-band spectrum for 5G monetization purrposes -- is up 3.1% in NYSE trading.
    • The joint proposal is worth some €2B-€5B to SES, Morgan Stanley says, raising its price target to €15.50 (shares are up 4.1% in Paris to €14.25). The FCC has said it will study the sharing proposal, and Intelsat has said there's potential for a final order in mid-2019 and a potential windfall by the end of next year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • COHR

    Coherent +7% on Apple's potential move to all OLED

    • OLED display manufacturer Coherent (NASDAQ:COHR) gains 7% to $186.23 on this morning’s report that Apple could switch to all OLED panels for this year’s batch of iPhones. 
    • Previously: iPhone display makers sink on OLED report (May 29)
    • Previously: Universal Display +12.4% on iPhone OLED report (May 29)
    • Previously: LG Display +4.1% on iPhone OLED panel report (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 17 Comments

    Midday Gainers / Losers (05/29/2018)

    • Gainers: CODX +65%. AXON +30%. ATV +24%. DHX +22%. MYND +19%. TUSK +19%. OCX +17%. LEJU +16%. MOMO +15%. EMX +15%.
    • Losers: TOPS -32%. NFEC -27%. EDUC -17%. AMPE -16%. IHT -16%. RRTS -16%. WMLP-OLD -15%. TTOO -11%. YRD -11%. FCSC -10%.

    | 12:35 PM
  • CODX

    Co-Diagnostics up 65%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Co-Diagnostics (CODX +64.8%) is up on a whopping 333x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action but the company will need additional capital at some point. At the end of March, it had $2.5M in cash while operations consumed $968K in Q1.
    • In July 2017, it filed a prospectus for the potential sale of ~424K shares by existing investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • PI

    Impinj +11.2% with no catalyst

    • Impinj (NASDAQ:PI) gains 11.2% to $18.62 with no clear catalyst.
    • The company has a 52-week range of $9.95 to $60.65.
    • PI shares are down 4.4% in the past week, up 36.9% in the past month, and down 25.7% YTD.       
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • HMNY

    Helios and Matheson +13.3% on Citadel Securities stake

    • Helios and Matheson (NASDAQ:HMNY) share jump 13.3% to $0.46 after disclosing that Citadel Securities has amassed 5.4% of the common stock.
    • Helios and Matheson is the majority owner of MoviePass.  
    • HMNY shares are down 39% in the past week, 84% this month, and 94% YTD.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM | 103 Comments
  • LPG

    Dorian LPG gets merger offer from BW LPG

    • Dorian LPG (LPG +4.7%) spikes higher after BW LPG (OTCPK:BWLLF) proposes an all-stock merger valued at $1.1B including debt.
    • BW LPG’s proposal represents a value of $7.86/share of Dorian common stock, representing a 13% premium to LPG's closing share price on May 25.
    • Shareholders would benefit from a stronger credit profile and improved scale via a combined fleet with better geographical coverage, says BW LPG CEO Martin Ackermann.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 5 Comments
  • MU

    Micron +2.4%, hits new 18-year high, no new catalyst

    • Micron (NASDAQ:MU) shares are up 2.4% to $62.83 with no new catalyst.  
    • The company hit a new 18-year high today and shares are up 19% since the catalyst-filled analyst day last week.
    • Micron shares are up 22% in the past month, 28% in the quarter, and 180% in the past year.  
    • Previously: Micron still trading higher on analyst day, $10B share repurchase (May 24)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 68 Comments
  • USO

    Stocks at session lows in early afternoon action

    • The major U.S. averages for most of the morning managed to mostly ignore the carnage in Europe, but the beginning of a possible rout is now underway.
    • Just after the noon hour, the S&P 500 is down 1.4%, the Dow 1.7%, and the Nasdaq 0.9%.
    • Hit hardest are the banks, with the XLF lower by 3.3%.
    • In commodities, oil continues to retreat, down 2.5% to $66.20 per barrel. USO -2.35%.
    • Money is pouring into safe government paper, with the 10-year Treasury yield down a full 11 basis points to 2.82%.
    • Europe closed the day down 1.4%, led by a 2.65% decline in Italy.
    • Previously: Periphery panic sparks selling in stocks, rally in Treasurys (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 24 Comments
  • IPSEY

    Ipsen in-licenses cancer candidate from MD Anderson

    • Ipsen (OTCPK:IPSEY) inks a global licensing and joint development agreement with MD Anderson's Institute for Applied Cancer Sciences for an unnamed oncology drug candidate.
    • MD Anderson will advance the candidate through Phase 1 after which Ipsen will take over, including commercialization.
    • Financial terms are not disclosed.
    • Shares are down 2% on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • WMS

    Advanced Drainage Systems up 10% post Q4 results

    • Advanced Drainage Systems (WMS +10.6%) reported Q4 net sales increase of 2.4% Y/Y to $250.11M due to favorable pricing and strong allied product sales in the construction market.
    • Segment sales: Pipe $176.85M (+0.7% Y/Y) with domestic sales of $159.32 (+0.1% Y/Y) and international sales of $17.51M (+5.8% Y/Y). Allied products $73.27M (+7% Y/Y) with domestic sales of $66.84M (+4% Y/Y) and international sales of $6.43M (+51.5% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross improved by 316 bps to 19.14% reflecting favorable pricing and lower manufacturing costs; operating recovered by 770 bps to -1.9% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 565 bps to 10.8%.
    • SG&A expenses decreased by 19% Y/Y to $46.46M.
    • FY19 Outlook: Net sales $1.375-1.245B vs 1.39B consensus; Adj. EBITDA $220-240M: Adj EBITDA margin 16-16.8% and Capex $60-70M.
    • Previously: Advanced Drainage Systems misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (May 29)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • AMWD

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (05/29/2018)

    • Gainers: AMWD +13%. WMS +12%. KOSS +12%. THST +7%. NAKD +6%.
    • Losers: ADOM -7%. OTIV -6%. BWA -6%. BRFS -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • AMPE

    Ampio to meet with FDA in July on Ampion BLA; shares down 15%

    • Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -15.1%) slumps on 40% higher volume in apparent response to its planned meeting with the FDA to discuss its BLA submission for Ampion for the treatment of osteoarthritis of the knee. Investors appear disappointed with the timeline, as the meeting is set for July.
    • On the bright side, the USPTO has awarded the company a new patent, No. 9,956,217, covering method of use for Ampion for joint conditions. It will be in effect until 2035.
    • Previously: Ampio updates regulatory, clinical and NYSE activities (April 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer wins U .S. approval for Monsanto purchase

    • The companies have reached an agreement with the DOJ for their merger. Green lights are still awaited from Canada and Mexico.
    • OTCPK:BAYRY -3.1%, MON +0.8%
    • Previously: Bloomberg: Bayer-Monsanto to win U.S. antitrust OK next week (May 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 8 Comments
  • INFN

    Infinera -9.1% as Jefferies moves to Sell on valuation

    • Infinera (NASDAQ:INFN) has slid 9.1% today after Jefferies trimmed its rating to Underperform, saying valuation has already priced in the upside case.

    • Elbit Systems (ESLT +2.9%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 9.3% Y/Y to $818.5M, the growth was driven by sales from the increased backlog and by the adoption of the ASC 606 revenue recognition standard.
    • Revenues by areas of operation: Airborne systems $311M (+7.1% Y/Y); C4ISR systems $275.2M (-1.4% Y/Y); Land systems $114.4M (+44.8% Y/Y); Electro-optic systems $88M (+15.2% Y/Y) & Others $29.9M (+22% Y/Y).
    • Revenues by geographical regions: Israel $185.6M (+10.9% Y/Y); North America $208.7M (+8.2% Y/Y); Europe $152.7M (-5.6% Y/Y); Asia-Pacific $173.6M (+4.5% Y/Y); Latin America $40.2M (+16.9% Y/Y) & Other countries $57.7M (+117.7% Y/Y).
    • Q1 overall margins: Adj. gross declined 100 bps to 29.3%; Adj. operating & Adj. net margin both declined 20 bps to 8.5% & 6.7% respectively.
    • Overall expenses: R&D of $68.2M (+16.8% Y/Y); M&S $68.2M (+3.6% Y/Y) & G&A of $35.7M (-7.8% Y/Y).
    • Backlogs: Totalled $8,046M (+13.3% Y/Y); ~74% of the current backlog is attributable to orders from outside Israel & ~60% of the current backlog is scheduled to be performed during 2018-2019.

  • PCG

    PG&E -5% as report blames company for some California wildfires

    • PG&E (PCG -4.8%) plunges at the open after Cal Fire's investigation determines at least three northern California wildfires last October were caused by the company's poor maintenance that allowed tree branches to come into contact with power lines.
    • Cal Fire says it found evidence that PG&E violated state laws in the Lobo fire and McCourtney fire in Nevada County as well as the Honey fire in Butte County, including not leaving adequate clearance between trees and power lines; PG&E did not break state rules in the La Porte fire in Butte County, according to the investigation.
    • “The key question will be if any of the fires resulted in negligence or imprudence on the part of the utility,” says Paul Patterson, a utility analyst at Glenrock Associates.
    • In response, PG&E says it meets or exceeds regulatory requirements for pole integrity management, but "years of drought, extreme heat and 129 million dead trees have created a 'new normal'" for California.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM | 10 Comments
